daily_summary.headline: SpaceX GPS III SV09 Launch Highlights a Day of Steady Space Activity

top_events.title: SpaceX Falcon 9 launches GPS III SV09 for US Space Force
top_events.description: A Falcon 9 Block 5 rocket launches the ninth GPS III navigation satellite, enhancing global positioning capabilities. The mission is notable for its national security significance and the use of a flight-proven booster.
top_events.action: Watch the official SpaceX webcast for live coverage.

top_events.title: Aurora G1 Storm Opportunity (Kp 4.67) on Jan 28
top_events.description: A minor geomagnetic storm may bring aurora visibility to high latitudes (65°+). Best viewing window is from 00:00 to 21:00 UTC on January 28.
top_events.action: Check northern skies if you are at high latitude.

top_events.title: Rocket Lab Electron to Launch NeonSat-1A
top_events.description: Rocket Lab's Electron will launch the NeonSat-1A Earth observation satellite for South Korea, supporting disaster monitoring and satellite technology development.
top_events.action: Watch Rocket Lab's webcast for mission updates.

opportunities.recommendation: Possible aurora at high latitudes. Best for northern locations (65°+). Worth checking if conditions are optimal.
